intro: Erigeron patagonicus, commonly known as the Patagonian fleabane, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces showy white to pale purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its foliage is usually hairy and grayish-green, adapted to withstand arid conditions.
